block.l: In a quaint village nestled between rolling hills, there was a small cottage with a charming garden. Among the many flowers that bloomed in this garden, one stood out in its vibrant and captivating beauty: a red rose. This red rose was not just any ordinary flower; it held a secret. Its petals held the whispers of lovers' promises, the warmth of summer sunsets, and the dreams of those who wandered by. Legend had it that the red rose was enchanted by a kind-hearted witch who had sought to preserve the essence of love and beauty within its delicate folds. As the seasons passed, the red rose's legend grew. People from neighboring villages traveled far and wide to catch a glimpse of the magnificent bloom. Some came seeking its magical powers, while others simply longed to be in the presence of such rare beauty. Among those who heard of the red rose was a young painter named Lucas. He had heard tales of the rose's enchanting allure and decided to make the journey to the village to see it for himself. Upon arriving, he was awestruck by the brilliance of the red petals, so vivid that they seemed to glow with an inner fire. Lucas knew that he had to capture this beauty on his canvas. Every day, Lucas would sit in the garden, sketching and painting the red rose with all the passion he could muster. He watched as its petals unfurled in the morning sun and curled up at night, as if embracing the passing day. As he painted, he found himself lost in the deep red hues, the delicate curves of the petals, and the way the light danced upon them. Over time, Lucas and the red rose formed an unspoken bond. He felt as though the rose understood him, that it whispered its secrets to him through the rustling leaves. He painted with a fervor he had never known before, pouring his heart and soul onto his canvas. One day, as the sun dipped below the horizon and the sky painted itself in hues of pink and gold, Lucas put the finishing touches on his masterpiece. The painting captured not only the red rose's physical beauty but also the essence of the emotions it had come to symbolize. With a contented sigh, Lucas signed his name in the corner and stepped back to admire his work. As he gazed at the painting, a gentle breeze swirled around him, carrying with it the sweet scent of the red rose. Lucas closed his eyes and smiled, feeling a deep sense of fulfillment and connection. He knew that this painting was more than just colors on a canvas—it was a tribute to the enchanting magic of the red rose and the love it embodied. And so, the legend of the red rose lived on, not only in the petals of the flower itself but also in the artistry it had inspired. Lucas's painting hung in galleries, enchanting all who gazed upon it, and reminding them of the timeless beauty of love and the profound connection between humans and nature.

block.l: In a garden nestled between two ancient oak trees, a delicate baby's breath flower began its journey. Its name was Flora, and she was unlike any other flower in the garden. While her neighbors stood tall and vibrant, Flora was petite and delicate, her petals resembling a soft cloud of white. Flora's journey began when a gentle breeze carried her tiny seed from a distant land. It landed in the fertile soil of the garden, and with the nurturing touch of sunlight and rain, Flora began to sprout. As she grew, her petals unfurled like the wings of a butterfly, and her fragrance filled the air with a subtle sweetness that attracted butterflies and bees alike. Among Flora's closest friends was a wise old butterfly named Aurelia. Aurelia had seen many seasons come and go, and she took Flora under her wing, teaching her about the cycles of life and the beauty of embracing change. Flora was fascinated by Aurelia's stories and looked forward to their daily conversations. As the seasons shifted, Flora noticed a pattern. The garden experienced moments of growth and moments of rest. Flowers would bloom, only to fade away, making space for new life. At first, this saddened Flora, but Aurelia assured her that this was the natural order of things. Change was an essential part of life, and it was what made each moment special. One day, a little girl named Lily visited the garden. Her eyes sparkled with wonder as she admired the vibrant flowers, but it was Flora's delicate beauty that caught her attention. Lily carefully plucked Flora from the ground, her heart touched by the flower's purity and grace. Flora felt a mixture of excitement and apprehension as she was gently placed in a small vase and carried to Lily's home. In Lily's room, Flora experienced a new phase of life. She watched as Lily cared for her, ensuring she had enough water and sunlight. Flora's delicate petals brightened Lily's room and brought a touch of nature indoors. Through the window, Flora observed the changing seasons and marveled at the way life continued its dance outside. As time passed, Flora began to wilt. Her once-vibrant petals grew pale, and her stem began to droop. Lily noticed Flora's transformation and felt a pang of sadness. She gently carried Flora back to the garden where they had first met. With a heavy heart, Lily placed Flora back into the soil, allowing her to return to the earth. Flora's journey had come full circle. As her petals fell away, they mingled with the soil, becoming nourishment for new plants. Flora's essence became a part of the garden, her beauty and wisdom spreading like a whisper among the flowers. And so, the delicate baby's breath flower, named Flora, taught those around her the beauty of embracing change and the transient nature of life. Her story became a reminder that even the most fragile and fleeting moments could leave a lasting impact, much like the gentle breath of a baby, leaving an indelible mark on the hearts of those it touched.

block.l: In a quiet corner of a charming countryside garden, a brilliant hydrangea named Hazel thrived. Her petals ranged from the softest shades of blue to the deepest purples, forming a mesmerizing gradient that captivated anyone who gazed upon her. Hazel stood tall and proud, her lush blooms drawing the attention of both humans and critters alike. Hazel's story began on a warm spring morning when a gentle rain shower kissed the earth. Her seeds, carried by the wind, found their way into the rich soil of the garden. As the days passed, tiny shoots emerged from the ground, and Hazel's vibrant life began to take shape. With each passing day, she grew stronger, her leaves unfurling like delicate emerald fans. Among her fellow garden residents, Hazel formed a unique bond with a curious squirrel named Squeaky. Squeaky would often scamper up Hazel's sturdy branches, searching for acorns to stash away for the winter. Hazel enjoyed the company and the rustling of leaves as Squeaky darted around her. As summer arrived, Hazel's blooms began to form. Clusters of delicate flowers adorned her branches, creating a stunning display of colors that shifted in the sunlight. Bees buzzed happily around her, drawn by the sweet nectar that Hazel offered. Their visits delighted Hazel, and she felt a sense of purpose knowing that she was contributing to the garden's ecosystem. One particularly sunny day, a young artist named Olivia visited the garden with her sketchbook in hand. She had heard about the exquisite hydrangea and was eager to capture its beauty on paper. Olivia settled beneath Hazel's branches, her pencil dancing across the page as she recreated the intricate patterns of Hazel's petals. In the weeks that followed, Olivia returned often, her sketches turning into intricate watercolor paintings. As Hazel watched Olivia's art evolve, she felt a deep sense of gratitude. It was as if Olivia had become her storyteller, sharing Hazel's beauty with the world in a way that only an artist could. But as the seasons changed, so did the garden's landscape. Autumn's arrival brought a cascade of colorful leaves, and soon after, the first frost painted the world with a delicate touch of white. Hazel's blooms began to fade, their vibrant colors giving way to muted tones. One chilly morning, as Hazel's petals fell to the ground, Olivia arrived with a heavy heart. She looked at Hazel, now bare of her blooms, and sighed. However, rather than sadness, Olivia's eyes held a kind of admiration that Hazel had never seen before. Olivia explained that even in her dormant state, Hazel's branches added a unique beauty to the winter garden, their structure holding a promise of future blooms. With a soft smile, Olivia promised to return in the spring, eager to capture Hazel's renewal in her artwork. And true to her word, as the first signs of spring emerged, Olivia once again sat beneath Hazel's branches, capturing the miraculous transformation in her paintings. Hazel's story was a testament to the cyclical nature of life, the beauty in both blooming and resting. Through the eyes of an artist, she learned that even in her quietest moments, she could still inspire and captivate, bringing joy and wonder to those who took the time to truly see her.

block.l: In the heart of a sweet countryside estate, there lived a remarkable camellia bush named Camilla. The estate was known far and wide for its stunning gardens, but Camilla held a special place among the flowers. Her glossy green leaves and captivating blooms enchanted anyone who had the privilege to witness her beauty. Camilla's story began many years ago, when a kind gardener planted her as a small sapling in the corner of the estate's main garden. With careful attention and love, Camilla flourished, her branches growing strong and her leaves glistening like emerald jewels. But it wasn't until her first bloom that her true magic was revealed. Every spring, Camilla would burst into a symphony of color, her petals unfurling like delicate silk. Her blossoms ranged from pure white to the deepest shades of pink and red, each one a testament to her elegance. People from neighboring towns would come to marvel at Camilla's splendor, and her fame spread throughout the land. Camilla, however, was not just a stunning flower; she was also a beacon of hope and solace. Many visitors would sit beside her, seeking refuge from their worries and sorrows. They found comfort in the serenity of her presence, as if her blooms held the power to mend broken hearts and ease troubled minds. Among Camilla's admirers was a young artist named Emma. Emma had recently moved to the countryside in search of inspiration for her paintings. The moment she laid eyes on Camilla, she was captivated by the flower's beauty. Emma would spend hours sitting beside Camilla, sketching her delicate petals and trying to capture the essence of her spirit on canvas. As the years passed, Emma's bond with Camilla deepened. She found herself sharing her hopes and dreams with the flower, believing that Camilla's silent presence held the wisdom of the ages. And in return, Camilla seemed to respond, swaying gently in the breeze as if offering her support. One winter, a harsh frost swept through the countryside, threatening to take away the beauty that Camilla had brought to the world. The gardener worked tirelessly to protect the delicate flowers, but even his efforts couldn't save all of them. Camilla's branches were covered in frost, and her blooms began to wither. Emma, devastated by the sight of Camilla's struggle, refused to give up. She spent hours tending to the wounded flower, carefully removing the frost and nurturing her back to health. Day by day, Camilla's leaves regained their vibrant hue, and her blooms began to open once more, a testament to her resilience. Spring arrived, and with it came a more glorious display of Camilla's blooms than ever before. Emma's dedication had saved the beloved camellia, and her story of love and determination spread throughout the countryside. Camilla's beauty became a symbol of hope, reminding everyone that even in the face of adversity, something magnificent could emerge. Years later, when Emma's paintings of Camilla adorned art galleries across the land, people would pause to admire the images that captured the spirit of the resilient camellia. And as they gazed upon those paintings, they couldn't help but feel the same sense of hope and renewal that Camilla had brought to the world, a reminder that beauty and strength could be found in even the most fragile of places.

block.l: In a serene corner of a sprawling countryside, a magnificent peony bush stood proudly. Its name was Persephone, and it was no ordinary peony. Persephone's petals were a breathtaking shade of deep, velvety pink, and their delicate fragrance perfumed the air around them, drawing admirers from far and wide. Persephone's journey began as a small bud, tightly nestled among the lush green leaves. As the warm sun and gentle rain embraced the countryside, the bud gradually unfurled, revealing layers of exquisitely textured petals. Each petal seemed like a brushstroke of nature's artistry, carefully painted with shades of pink that shifted and blended in harmony. The garden was a bustling ecosystem, filled with various creatures who came to marvel at Persephone's beauty. Among her regular visitors was a curious hummingbird named Amara. Amara's iridescent feathers glinted in the sunlight as she hovered near Persephone, sipping nectar from her velvety petals. They struck up a friendship, with Amara sharing stories of her travels and Persephone offering a fragrant haven for the hummingbird to rest. As the seasons changed, Persephone's blooms became a symbol of fleeting beauty. People from nearby villages and towns would make pilgrimages to witness her splendor, capturing her essence through paintings and poems. Among these admirers was a young artist named Eliana. Inspired by Persephone's elegance, Eliana spent hours beneath the shade of the peony bush, capturing its essence on her canvas. One evening, as the sun cast its golden glow over the countryside, a gentle breeze whispered through Persephone's petals. The breeze carried the faint scent of change, hinting at the approaching autumn. Persephone knew that her time was drawing to a close, but she welcomed this next phase of her journey with grace. Eliana, who had visited Persephone daily, noticed the subtle change in her blooms. She painted the peony in all its stages, capturing the full spectrum of its beauty. As the first frost painted the landscape with a delicate touch of white, Persephone's petals began to fade. Yet, even in this waning beauty, she held a unique allure, with her petals softening to a delicate shade of blush. On a cool morning, as the sun began to rise, Persephone's final petals drifted gently to the ground. Eliana arrived, her heart heavy with both sorrow and gratitude. She gazed at the now-bare bush, remembering every moment she had spent capturing its magic on canvas. But just as the cycle of life continued, so did Persephone's legacy. Eliana placed a small bouquet of dried peony petals in a vase, preserving their memory. She continued to paint, inspired by the lessons Persephone had taught her about embracing change and finding beauty in every phase of life. And so, even after Persephone's petals had faded, her spirit lingered on, inspiring both Amara the hummingbird and Eliana the artist to carry her story forward. The memory of the magnificent peony named Persephone remained etched in the hearts of those who had been touched by her fleeting, yet enduring, beauty.

block-definition.s: Ask %'cloud provider' to say what it sees then %'then receive response' and show the picture %'show photo?'

block-definition.comment: Takes a photo and ask the cloud provider to recognize it. Reports the response when it arrives.

block-definition.s: Current image property from %'cloud provider' $nl with %'property name or names' property names
block-definition.comment: Reports a property of the most recent recognition by the AI cloud provider. Visit tinyurl.com/vision-snap to learn more.
Reports the best caption from the last image recognition that Microsoft did.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the tags from the last image recognition by Google.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the confidence scores of the 'Google labels' from the last image recognition by Google.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the tags of the last image recognition by Microsoft.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the labels describing the most recent image recognised by the specified vision service provider.

block-definition.s: Do %'handle response' with what %'provider' sees $nl and show the photo %'show'
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture. When the AI vision provider responds runs the blocks on the labels in the response. Can optionally display the photo.

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.comment: Takes a picture, asks the AI vision cloud provider to classify it, and reports the response when it arrives.

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what %txt sees %br and show the photo %b

block-definition.comment: Reports the confidence scores for each of the labels described in the vision service provider's most recent response.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.s: Train with all my costumes with label %'label'
block-definition.comment: Send all the costumes of this sprite off to the training tab with the specified label.

custom-block.s: Add costume %obj %br to the training with label %txt %br then %cmdRing with the response

block-definition.s: Ask %'cloud provider' to analyse costume %'costume' then %'receive response'
block-definition.comment: Sends the pixels of the costume to one of the vision recognition service providers and then runs the provided blocks with the respnse.

block-definition.s: Add costume %'costume' $nl to the training with label %'label' $nl then %'process response' with the response
block-definition.comment: Adds the costume to the training set of 'label'. Before calling this the 'Prepare for training images with these labels ..." block needs to be run to specify the list of labels and start up the training tab.

block-definition.s: load camera training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads saved training from the URL.

block-definition.s: load camera training data from file then %'after loading training data'
%'top n' labels for costume %'costume' %'receive labels' with the labels %'receive probabilities' with the probabilities
block-definition.comment: Uses the MobileNet deep learning image recognition model inside your brower. Nothing is sent to the cloud. Note that this model has been trained on 1000 categories but not people.
Reports the 'top n' labels for the costume. Note that this model has been trained on 1000 categories but not people.

custom-block.s: %n labels for costume %obj %cs with the labels %cs with the probabilities

block-definition.comment: Reports the probabilities (or confidences) that the labels for the costume are correct.

custom-block.s: %n labels for costume %obj %cs with the labels %cs with the probabilities

block.comment: Change to percentages with 3 digits accuracy.

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is ready to answer queries from Snap!.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Detect objects in costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options' $nl process response %'process detections' $nl and if there is an error %'process error'

block-definition.comment: Reports the objects in the costume together with their boudning box (upper left corner, width, and height), and confidence score. Details at https:/ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-4.html#detection

custom-block.s: Detect objects in costume %s %br with options %l %br process response %cmdRing %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

custom-block.l: Block expected to be given a costume.

block-definition.comment: Reports the bounding box of the detected object in stage coordinates.
Draws the outline of the bounding box.

block-definition.s: display bounding boxes and labels of %'objects'
Setup camera %'width' %'height' then when ready %'do when camera is ready'
block-definition.comment: Specifies the resolution of the image sent for recogntion.

custom-block.comment: Check if already ready to avoid the 1 second wait

block.comment: Wait a bit more because otherwise a black image is captured.

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.
Reports the confidence scores using the training from 'Add costume ... to the training with label ...'

custom-block.s: Analyse costume %obj then %br %cmdRing %br with the list of label confidences %br use votes from top %n matching costumes

block-definition.s: Train with image buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: This will launch a training window where you can show the system examples of each of the labels in 'bucket names'. If 'add to previous training' is false then training will start over from scratch. Optionally you can provide HTML that will appear instead of the default on the training tab. Finally one can provide commands that will run when the user returns to Snap! from the training panel.
Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.s: Prepare for training images with these labels %'labels' $then do %'do when ready'
block-definition.comment: Sets things up for training with these labels but does not display the support window.

block-definition.s: Get prediction for costume %'costume' $nl using Teachable Machine %'type' model %'URL' $nl then do with result %'do with prediction' $nl or else if there is an error %'do if error'
block-definition.comment: The URL should be created by https://teachablemachine.withgoogle.com/train/image The prediction will be the input to the the 'do with prediction' blocks It is a list of lists of the class name and its probability..

block-definition.s: Get prediction for costume %'costume' using Teachable Machine %'type' model %'URL'
block-definition.comment: The URL should be created by https://teachablemachine.withgoogle.com/train/image This reports a list of lists of class names and probabilities or a textual error message.

custom-block.s: Get prediction for costume %s %br using Teachable Machine %txt model %txt %br then do with result %cmdRing %br or else if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person - 0 confidence there is a nose - 1 location of nose - 2 confidence there is a left eye - 3 location of left eye - 4 confidence there is a right eye - 5 location of right eye - 6 confidence there is a left ear - 7 location of left ear - 8 confidence there is a right ear - 9 location of right ear - 10 confidence there is a left shoulder - 11 location of leff shoulder - 12 confidence there is a right shoulder - 13 location of right shoulder - 14 confidence there is a left elbow - 15 location of left elbow - 16 confidence there is a right elbow - 17 location of right elbow - 18 confidence there is a left wrist - 19 location of left wrist - 20 confidence there is a right wrist - 21 location of right wrist - 22 confidence there is a left hip - 23 location of left hip - 24 confidence there is a right hip - 25 location of right hip - 26 confidence there is a left knee - 27 location of left knee - 28 confidence there is a right knee - 29 location of right knee - 30 confidence there is a left ankle - 31 location of left ankle - 32 confidence there is a right ankle - 33 location of right ankle - 34

block.comment: 'property name' ends with hypen and a number and this extracts that number. Add 0 to ensure it is a number and not text.

block-definition.s: pose property %'location or confidence' of %'left or right' %'body part' from %'pose'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: eye ear shoulder elbow wrist hip knee ankle nose person

block.comment: Only the nose has no left or right versions.
Property numbers range from 0 to 34 to identify different information in a pose.
Confidence that there is a person at all.
Location extracted from [["x" 1] ["y" 2]]. Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block-definition.s: pose property %'location or confidence' of %'left or right' %'body part' from %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100 or the location of a body part as two numbers. If 'stage coordinates' is true then the location matches the stage coordinates, otherwise it is between 0 and 100.

input.options: eye ear shoulder elbow wrist hip knee ankle nose person

pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b
pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b

Property numbers range from 0 to 34 to identify different information in a pose.

block.comment: Confidence that there is a person at all.
Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block.l: confidence it is a person confidence there is a nose location of nose confidence there is a left eye location of left eye confidence there is a right eye location of right eye confidence there is a left ear location of left ear confidence there is a right ear location of right ear confidence there is a left shoulder location of left shoulder confidence there is a right shoulder location of right shoulder confidence there is a left elbow location of left elbow confidence there is a right elbow location of right elbow confidence there is a left wrist location of left wrist confidence there is a right wrist location of right wrist confidence there is a left hip location of left hip confidence there is a right hip location of right hip confidence there is a left knee location of left knee confidence there is a right knee location of right knee confidence there is a left ankle location of left ankle confidence there is a right ankle location of right ankle

block-definition.s: pose property %'property name' of %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100 or the location of a body part as two numbers. If 'stage coordinates' is true then the location matches the stage coordinates, otherwise it is between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person confidence there is a nose location of nose confidence there is a left eye location of left eye confidence there is a right eye location of right eye confidence there is a left ear location of left ear confidence there is a right ear location of right ear confidence there is a left shoulder location of left shoulder confidence there is a right shoulder location of right shoulder confidence there is a left elbow location of left elbow confidence there is a right elbow location of right elbow confidence there is a left wrist location of left wrist confidence there is a right wrist location of right wrist confidence there is a left hip location of left hip confidence there is a right hip location of right hip confidence there is a left knee location of left knee confidence there is a right knee location of right knee confidence there is a left ankle location of left ankle confidence there is a right ankle location of right ankle

block-definition.comment: Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.

block-definition.s: Analyse costume %'costume' then $nl %'process response' $nl with the list of label confidences $nl use votes from top %'top k' matching costumes
block-definition.comment: 'process response' is passed the confidence scores using the training from 'Train with image buckets ...'
No longer needed in Snap! 7+ but retained to avoid error from blocks that expect it.

block-definition.s: get costume features of %'costume' then %'receive features'
block-definition.comment: Passes to 'receive features' a vector of 1280 numbers that captures many features of the costume.
Reports a vector of 1280 numbers that captures many features of the costume.

block-definition.s: hand poses of costume %'costume' $nl with these options: %'options'
%'handedness' hand pose of costume %'costume' $nl with these options: %'options'

block-definition.s: face detection using costume %'costume' $nl with these options: %'options'
Go to object detection and segmentation blocks

block-definition.comment: Reports the depth of each pixel in the costume of the face of the person where 1 is the closest and 0 the furthest

custom-block.s: Poses or landmarks of costume %s using %txt %br with options %mult%s %br do with response %cmdRing %br unless if error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: hand poses of costume %'costume' $nl using %'transform type' coordinates $nl with these options: %'options'
block-definition.comment: Reports the 2D and 3D locations of 21 parts of each hand visible in the costume together whether the handedness is a left or right and a confidence score that it has detected a hand. For full documentation including options click the help: https://github.com/tensorflow/tfjs-models/tree/master/hand-pose-detection

custom-block.s: Poses or landmarks of costume %s using %txt %br with options %mult%s %br do with response %cmdRing %br unless if error %cmdRing

block.comment: Turn the result into a form easier to see and use.

block-definition.s: face detection using costume %'costume' $nl using %'transform type' coordinates
block-definition.comment: Reports six locations on the face along with the coordinates of the smallest box that encloses the entire face.

custom-block.s: Poses or landmarks of costume %s using %txt %br with options %mult%s %br do with response %cmdRing %br unless if error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: body segmentations of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options'
block-definition.comment: Reports information about people in the image. Can include body part segmentations, poses, and a costume colored by type of body part depending upon the 'options'. See https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-4.html#segmentation

custom-block.s: body segmentations of costume %s %br with options %l %br process response %cmdRing %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: body segmentations of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options' $nl process response %'process segmentations and poses' $nl and if there is an error %'process error'
body segmentation of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options'
block-definition.comment: Reports information about people in the image. Can include body part segmentation and a costume colored by type of body part depending upon the 'options'. See https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-4.html#segmentation

custom-block.s: body segmentation of costume %s %br with options %l %br process response %cmdRing %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: body segmentation of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options' $nl process response %'process segmentation and pose' $nl and if there is an error %'process error'

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.

custom-block.s: Create costume from camera %b and pass it to %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Create costume from camera %'mirrored' and pass it to %'process costume'
block-definition.comment: Creates a costume from the video camera and passes it the 'process costume' blocks.

block-definition.s: face landmarks in costume %'costume' $nl using %'transform type' coordinates $nl with these options: %'options'
block-definition.comment: Reports the 3D locations of 468 facial "landmarks" as well as the bounding box of the face. For full documentation including options click the following help: https://github.com/tensorflow/tfjs-models/tree/master/face-landmarks-detection/src/tfjs

block.comment: Used to convert the coordinates to stage or percentage

custom-block.s: Poses or landmarks of costume %s using %txt %br with options %mult%s %br do with response %cmdRing %br unless if error %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.

block-definition.s: body poses of costume %'costume' $nl using model %'model' $nl using %'transform type' coordinates $nl with these options: %'options'
block-definition.comment: Reports the locations of 17 or 33 body parts for each body detected in the costume. Three models are available: MoveNet is an ultra fast and accurate model that detects 17 keypoints of a body. BlazePose can detect 33 keypoints, it provides additional keypoints for face, hands and feet. It reports both 2D and 3D locations. PoseNet can detect multiple poses, each pose contains 17 keypoints. For full documentation including options click the following help: https://github.com/tensorflow/tfjs-models/tree/master/pose-detection

input.options: MoveNet is an ultra fast and accurate model that detects 17 keypoints of a body. BlazePose can detect 33 keypoints, it provides additional keypoints for face, hands and feet. PoseNet can detect multiple poses, each pose contains 17 keypoints.

custom-block.s: Poses or landmarks of costume %s using %txt %br with options %mult%s %br do with response %cmdRing %br unless if error %cmdRing

block.comment: Turn the result into a form easier to see and use.

block-definition.s: transform %'coordinate' as %'x or y' coordinate to %'type of transform'
block-definition.comment: Converts costume coordinates to stage or percentage

block-definition.s: Poses or landmarks of costume %'costume' using %'model name' $nl with options %'options' $nl do with response %'do with response' $nl unless if error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: This is the workhorse behind the reporters for the body and hand poses and face landmarks.

input.options: MoveNet PoseNet BlazePose MediaPipeFaceDetector MediaPipeFaceMesh MediaPipeHands ARPortraitDepth

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl using the MARY text-to-speech service $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice' (number or name). 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. Will wait until the speaking is finished if 'wait' is true.
Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

custom-block.s: check for voices %cmdRing if no voices otherwise do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: check for voices %'do if no voices' if no voices otherwise do %'do if voices'
Speak %'message' then %'to do when finished speaking'

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Should be lower case language code, then a hypen, then upper case dialect code. if no hypen is given then dialect code should be the same as the language code. E.g.as with fr-FR or id-ID. Visit Wikipedia IETF language tag for more information.

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice name or number (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voice names'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.

custom-block.s: Get prediction for costume %s %br using Teachable Machine %txt model %txt %br then do with result %cmdRing %br or else if there is an error %cmdRing
